title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
text:
Context: Malta-archaeology



Decades of development-led archaeology
Many projects
Many excavation reports





(Source: Visser 2025, fig. 03.18)

text:

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
text:
Urban farming
“the use of land in, and directly around a town for agricultural activities with the aim of producing food”
small-scale arable farming:

horticulture,
orchards,
livestock farming
fish farming

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
text:
Selection of data

Excavation between 1997-2017
2,278 ARCHIS case identifications
Download 2,278 pdf-reports from various sources


(Source: Fischer et al. 2021, Table 3.2)

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
section: Saved by text mining: reading by script
text:
Saved by text mining: reading by script



Convert PDF to plain text (OCR if needed)
Term Document Matrix (count individual words)
Create word cloud of document
Store TDF in PostgreSQL-database

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
text:
Finding the right words: keywords



animal husbandry, e.g. animals
arable farming, e.g plant names, tools
horticulture, e.g. plant names, utensils
general urban farming, e.g. farming terms
orchards, e.g. fruits





(Source: Fischer et al. 2021, fig. 2.22)

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
section: Matching keywords with text from documents
text:
Matching keywords with text from documents

Valuing keywords

Important value 4, e..g plant names
Less important 1, e.g. arable farming

Match keywords with text of document (SQL-query)
Scoring document

Sum(Occurence of keyword * value of keyword)

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming

text:
Ranked reports



Relevant

rank A: 26 reports
rank B: 183 reports

Possibly relevant

rank C: 899 reports

Irrelevant

rank D: 152 reports
rank E: 48 reports



Sample of 100 reports of each rank read to test assumption

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
text:
Time saving

Start: 1380 reports (1448 PDF)
Relevant 265 reports analysed

Structured analyes
Database
Themes

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
text:
Dating challenges



Varied dates

Periods (Archaeological Basic Register (ABR))
Exact dating
Date ranges

Combined with summarized probabilities





(Source: Fischer et al. 2021, fig. 3.8)

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
text:
Conclusion

Archaeologists produce too much reports
Text mining can save a lot of work
Urban farming was very common

title: Text Mining for Urban Farming
text:
References



https://github.com/RonaldVisser/TextMiningUrbanFarming_IWGP2025



Fischer, A. D., H. van Londen, A. L. Blonk-van den Bercken, R. M. Visser, and J. Renes. 2021. Urban Farming and Ruralisation in the Netherlands (1250 up Tot the Nineteenth Century), Unravelling Farming Practice and the Use of (Open) Space by Synthesising Archaeological Reports Using Text Mining. Nederlandse Archeologische Rapporten 68. Amersfoort: Rijksdienst voor het Cultureel Erfgoed. https://www.cultureelerfgoed.nl/publicaties/publicaties/2021/01/01/urban-farming-and-ruralisation-in-the-netherlands.


Rutte, Reinout, and Jaap Evert Abrahamse, eds. 2016. Atlas of the Dutch urban landscape: a millennium of spatial development. Bussum: THOTH Publishers.


Visser, Ronald M. 2025. “Relating Roman Rings. An Interdisciplinary Study Using Archaeology, Data Science and Tree Rings to Understand Timber Provision in the German Provinces of the Roman Empire.” PhD thesis, Amsterdam. https://doi.org/10.5463/thesis.1062.
